name: I-India
briefDescription: I-India’s mission is to provide care, love and development for children living on the streets of Jaipur. Also to create a comprehensive system of services to fulfill street and working children’s long-term needs for education, skills, and emotional support, as well as their short-term needs for nutrition, health and shelter. The organization’s vision is to create a nurturing environment that can foster normal physical and mental growth of street and neglected children. To allow them to return to mainstream society and eventually contribute to its development.Currently, the organization reach over 2000 children daily through its street schools, contact points/street schools, residential homes, children’s village, mobile health vans, school on wheels, shower bus and vocational training centres.  I-India’s main activities are the provision of:•	an information/advice help line for street children in need (Childline 1098)•	repatriation of children to their families•	temporary and permanent homes (4 permanent & 2 temporary shelter homes)•	medical care and sanitation (health centre and mobile health vehicle)•	nutrition (Annapurna Kitchen for street children)•	emotional support and counselling•	education (non-formal & formal education)•	vocational training•	awareness, advocacy and research
